data.title: Seymour Reit Joe Oriolo: The Friendly Ghost
data.meta_description: CASPER STORY - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Casper the Friendly Ghost was created in the late 1930s by Seymour Reit and Joe Oriolo as the basis for a children's storybook. Oriolo sold the rights to the book to Paramount Pictures for $175 before it was published. The first Casper cartoon was released in 1945. In it, Casper is a ghost child who wants to make friends with humans and animals but scares them away until he meets two children. Later Casper cartoons from the 1950s followed a similar formula where Casper would try to find friends but scare others until helping a child or person, gaining their acceptance. The Casper series was popular but later criticized for its repetitive story structure.
